result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel Lee Russell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Concurrent to 14CF240.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant remanded into custody.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

superMiscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF255.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probatiion in Count 1 Case #14CF255.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to knowingly associate with anyone who uses, manufactures or deals drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Random and regular testing.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley DF ATTY: Francis Xavier Rivard DF: Samuel Lee Russell appeared in custody.  Case called at 2:24. Includes 14CF240, 14CF255. Court reviews files. Atty. Rivard believes there are no corrections. ADA McKinley addresses errors in PSI. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Sentencing arguments. DE has completed the matrix program in jail. DE makes statement. DE had been accepted to St. Joseph in patient treatment center in MN. DE would like to attend inpatient treatment upon his release. DE has to serve time in Chisago County. Crt orders:
In 14CF240 
- 1 year initial confinement, 2yrs. extended supervision.
- Costs
In 14CF255 
- 2 years inital confinement, 5 yrs extended supervision concurrent to 14CF240.
- Costs
- Court notes 278 days credit. 
Conditions:
- No to knowingly associate with anyone who uses, manufactures or deals drugs except in a treatment setting. 
- Complete AODA and any follow through.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- DE to provide a DNA sample
- Random and regular drug testing. 
- 40 hours of community service, court recommends public speaking.
DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
DE is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 
DE is remanded into custody.
Court orders time to be concurrent to any other sentence.

ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Francis X. Rivard DF: Samuel Lee Russell appeared in custody. Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. Case called at  Includes 14CF240, 14CF255 and 14TR1814. Court reviews file. ADA Hartung makes recommendations amending the 14CF255 to 1st degree reckless endangering safety. Atty. Rivard agrees.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads guilty to Ct 1 in 14CF240 and guilty to amended charge of 2nd degree of reckless endangering safety in 14CF255. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct1 in 14CF240 and guilty to amended charge in 14CF255 to 2nd degree reckless endangering safety. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 14CF240 , 14TR1814. Case 14CF240 has been judicially transferred to Branch 3. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders a PSI due March 9, 2015. A PSI  is in the process of being completed in Polk County. Bail revoked. DE remanded into custody.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Preliminary hearing on July 2, 2014 at 09:00 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, M.R.K. dob 10/10/1995.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
